intro: Fosbergia petelotii, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame tree, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with small, ovate leaflets and produces woody, branched stems. It thrives in tropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Fosbergia petelotii is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
